pageContext._xxxcollectionTitlextxt: Spinning on air : radio broadcast, 1995-10-10 : Favorite driving tape : Morricone obscurities.
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: David Garland plays a compilation tape of various unidentified film music tracks composed by Ennio Morricone in the 1970s: Revolver (1972), Tre donne (Three women, 1971), Kill the fatted calf and eat it (1970), Veruschka (1971), Spazmo (1974), Forza G (1971) and other unidentified films. According to Garland, this is his "favorite driving tape". The tape was compiled for Garland by longtime listener Peter Muller. [Side A] (starts at 3:36) ; Side B (starts at 34:10)
